content:
Subject otherwise to the Terms of the Policy.

#### M01 - Cover Whilst Driven By A Motor Trader
It is hereby understood and agreed that notwithstanding anything contained to the contrary in the Limitations as to Use but subject otherwise to the Terms of this Policy the insurance granted thereby shall be operative but only so far as it relates to the Policyholder whilst the Insured Vehicle is in the custody or control of a member of the Motor Trade for the purpose of overhaul upkeep or repair.
questions: What does the M01 cover in the policy specifically address?
Is the insurance still valid when the vehicle is with a motor trader for repairs?
Does the M01 cover extend to any motor trader or specific ones?
What are the limitations of using the M01 cover?
Under what conditions does the M01 cover become operative?
What types of vehicle services are included under the M01 cover?
Are there any specific terms that need to be met for the M01 cover to be valid?
What does 'custody or control of a member of the Motor Trade' mean in the context of the M01 cover?
How does the M01 cover affect the overall terms of the policy?
Can the M01 cover be applied to any vehicle under the policy or only the insured vehicle?
